endpoints.description: Endpoint that serves Prometheus metrics.
GET operation for /health/live in query_service.
GET operation for /health/ready in query_service.
Returns portfolios with optional filtering by portfolio ID, CIF, and booking center. Used by UI/lotus-gateway for portfolio discovery and navigation.

endpoints.summary: Get a Single Portfolio by ID
endpoints.description:
Retrieves a single portfolio by its unique ID.
Returns a `404 Not Found` if the portfolio does not exist.

endpoints.summary: Get Position History for a Security
endpoints.description: Returns epoch-aware position history for a portfolio-security key across a date range. Used for drill-down views and lineage-aware troubleshooting.

endpoints.summary: Get Latest Positions for a Portfolio
endpoints.description: Returns latest current-epoch positions for a portfolio. Used by holdings screens and downstream review/analytics flows.

endpoints.summary: Get BUY Lot State for a Position
endpoints.description: Returns durable BUY lot records for a portfolio-security key, including linkage and policy metadata used for lifecycle traceability.
Returns accrued-income offset state initialized by BUY events for a portfolio-security key.
Returns security-side BUY linkage fields and linked cashflow details for reconciliation.
Returns transactions for a portfolio with filters, pagination, and sorting. Designed for transaction ledgers, audit timelines, and investigative support.
Returns reference instrument records with optional filtering by security and product type. Used by lookup selectors and enrichment workflows.

endpoints.summary: Get Market Prices for a Security
endpoints.description: Returns market price series for a security with optional date-range filtering. Used by valuation checks and market data diagnostics.

endpoints.summary: Get FX Rates for a Currency Pair
endpoints.description: Returns FX rates for a currency pair over an optional date range. Used by valuation/performance conversion diagnostics and reconciliation.

endpoints.summary: Get operational support overview for a portfolio
endpoints.description:
What: Return support-oriented operational state for one portfolio.
How: Aggregate reprocessing, valuation, and latest-data availability markers for the key.
When: Use during incidents to quickly assess whether portfolio processing is healthy.

endpoints.summary: List valuation jobs for support workflows
endpoints.description:
What: List valuation jobs for a portfolio with support filters.
How: Query valuation job records with pagination and optional status filtering.
When: Use to triage stuck valuation workloads and verify drain progress.

endpoints.summary: List aggregation jobs for support workflows
endpoints.description:
What: List portfolio aggregation jobs for support workflows.
How: Query aggregation job records with pagination and optional status filtering.
When: Use when portfolio rollups are stale or downstream timeseries appears delayed.

endpoints.summary: Get lineage state for a portfolio-security key
endpoints.description:
What: Return lineage state for one portfolio-security key.
How: Read epoch, watermark, and latest artifact pointers from lineage state services.
When: Use during replay/reprocessing investigations for deterministic state validation.

endpoints.summary: List lineage keys for a portfolio
endpoints.description:
What: List lineage keys for a portfolio.
How: Query portfolio-security lineage rows with status/security filters and pagination.
When: Use to scope impacted keys before running replay, backfill, or targeted recovery.
Returns effective policy diagnostics and provenance for the given consumer and tenant context, including strict-mode behavior and allowed sections.
Returns baseline or simulation snapshot sections for an integration consumer. Supports positions baseline/projected/delta, portfolio totals, and instrument enrichment.

endpoints.summary: Resolve issuer enrichment for security identifiers
endpoints.description: Returns issuer enrichment for a caller-provided security_id list. Records are deterministic and preserve request order. Unknown securities are returned with null issuer fields.
Returns backend-governed lotus-core capability and workflow flags for a consumer system and tenant context. Intended for lotus-gateway/UI and lotus-manage feature control.
Returns portfolio selector options for lotus-gateway/UI portfolio selection workflows.
Returns instrument selector options for lotus-gateway/UI trade and intake workflows.
Returns distinct currency selector options derived from portfolio base currencies and instrument currencies.
Create a simulation session for a portfolio.
Get simulation session metadata by session identifier.
Close an active simulation session.
Add or update simulation changes for a session.
Delete a simulation change from a session.
Return projected positions after applying session changes.
Return projected summary metrics for a simulation session.
Endpoint that serves Prometheus metrics.
GET operation for /health/live in ingestion_service.
GET operation for /health/ready in ingestion_service.

What: Accept canonical portfolio master records.
How: Validate portfolio schema, enforce idempotency/mode checks, and publish asynchronously for persistence.
When: Use when onboarding or updating portfolio metadata from upstream systems.

What: Accept one canonical transaction record for ledger ingestion.
How: Validate contract, enforce idempotency/mode controls, then publish asynchronously to Kafka.
When: Use for low-volume operational corrections or single-record onboarding.

What: Accept a batch of canonical transaction records.
How: Persist ingestion job metadata, validate payload, and publish all valid records asynchronously.
When: Use for standard API-driven batch ingestion workflows.

What: Accept canonical instrument/security reference records.
How: Validate schema, enforce ingestion mode/idempotency controls, and publish to asynchronous persistence pipeline.
When: Use for security master onboarding and reference data corrections.

What: Accept canonical market price observations for securities.
How: Validate payload, enforce ingestion guardrails, and publish asynchronous events for valuation processing.
When: Use for daily close pricing loads or intraday approved market data updates.

What: Accept canonical foreign-exchange rate observations.
How: Validate FX rate contract, enforce ingestion controls, and publish asynchronous events for downstream valuation.
When: Use for scheduled FX reference updates and approved manual corrections.

What: Accept canonical business calendar dates used by valuation and processing lifecycles.
How: Validate date records, apply ingestion controls, and publish asynchronous persistence events.
When: Use for calendar setup, holiday updates, and date-correction operations.

What: Accept transaction identifiers that require deterministic historical recalculation.
How: Validate request, persist ingestion job metadata, and publish reprocessing command events.
When: Use for operational correction workflows after retroactive data changes.

What: Accept a mixed onboarding bundle containing portfolio, instrument, transaction, market-price, FX-rate, and business-date records.
How: Validate adapter payload and fan out records into existing canonical ingestion topics.
When: Use for adapter-mode onboarding (UI/manual/file workflows), not primary upstream integration.

endpoints.summary: Preview and validate bulk upload data
endpoints.description:
What: Validate CSV/XLSX ingestion payloads without publishing records.
How: Parse file rows, apply entity-specific schema checks, and return row-level validation feedback.
When: Use before commit to catch data-quality issues in bulk adapter uploads.

What: Commit CSV/XLSX data into canonical ingestion topics.
How: Validate rows, enforce mode controls, and publish valid records (optionally partial when allowPartial=true).
When: Use after preview passes for adapter-mode bulk ingestion.

What: Return lifecycle state and metadata for one ingestion job.
How: Read canonical ingestion-job state by job_id.
When: Use to track asynchronous ingestion completion or failure for a submitted request.

What: List ingestion jobs with operational filtering and pagination.
How: Query canonical job records using status/entity/date filters and cursor pagination.
When: Use for runbook dashboards, triage, and service-operations monitoring.

What: Return failure events recorded for a specific ingestion job.
How: Read ingestion job failure history with most-recent-first ordering.
When: Use during incident triage to identify failure phases and impacted record keys.

What: Return record-level replayability and failed keys for an ingestion job.
How: Derive replayable keys from stored payload and merge with failure history.
When: Use before partial retry operations or to build precise remediation batches.

What: Retry a failed ingestion job using full or partial payload replay.
How: Rehydrate stored request payload, apply optional record-key filtering, and republish asynchronously.
When: Use after root cause remediation to recover failed ingestion without direct DB operations.

What: Return aggregate ingestion counters (accepted/queued/failed/backlog).
How: Compute summary from canonical ingestion job state.
When: Use for fast operational health checks and dashboards.

What: Return backlog-oriented counters derived from non-terminal jobs.
How: Reuse canonical health summary state for lag visibility.
When: Use when operations need a quick backlog signal during ingestion incidents.

What: Return consumer lag diagnostics derived from DLQ pressure and backlog signals.
How: Aggregate consumer dead-letter events by consumer group and original topic.
When: Use to triage downstream consumer lag before replaying ingestion jobs.

What: Evaluate ingestion SLO signals for failure rate, queue latency, and backlog age.
How: Compute lookback-window metrics and compare against caller thresholds.
When: Use for alert evaluation, on-call triage, and operational readiness checks.

endpoints.summary: Get ingestion error-budget and backlog-growth status
endpoints.description:
What: Return current error-budget consumption and backlog growth trend.
How: Compare failure/backlog metrics across current and previous lookback windows.
When: Use for SRE-style burn-rate alerts and release-go/no-go operational checks.

endpoints.summary: Get ingestion backlog breakdown by endpoint and entity
endpoints.description:
What: Return grouped backlog/failure-rate metrics by endpoint and entity type.
How: Aggregate canonical ingestion jobs into endpoint/entity groups with oldest backlog age.
When: Use to isolate the highest-impact ingestion pipeline segment during incidents.

What: List ingestion jobs stalled in accepted/queued state beyond threshold.
How: Filter canonical jobs by age and status, then attach runbook-oriented suggestions.
When: Use to identify concrete stuck jobs requiring operator intervention.

What: Return dead-letter events produced by downstream consumers.
How: Query persisted consumer DLQ audit records with optional topic/group filters.
When: Use to investigate consumer-side validation/processing failures without DB access.

endpoints.summary: Replay ingestion payload for correlated consumer DLQ event
endpoints.description:
What: Replay canonical ingestion payload correlated to a consumer DLQ event.
How: Resolve DLQ event -> correlation_id -> ingestion job with durable payload, then republish.
When: Use after fixing downstream consumer defects to recover rejected events safely.

What: Return replay audit records across ingestion recovery paths.
How: Query durable replay audit rows with filters for recovery path, status, fingerprint, and job.
When: Use for incident forensics and replay governance review.

endpoints.summary: Get one ingestion replay audit record
endpoints.description:
What: Return one replay audit row by replay_id.
How: Read durable replay audit event from canonical operations store.
When: Use to inspect a specific replay action referenced in incident timelines.

What: Return current ingestion control mode and replay window.
How: Read canonical ingestion operations control state.
When: Use before maintenance, pause/drain actions, or controlled replay operations.

What: Update ingestion control mode and optional replay window.
How: Persist operational mode transition with validation on replay window boundaries.
When: Use for planned maintenance, controlled drain, or replay governance actions.

What: Return operational diagnostics for ingestion idempotency key reuse and collisions.
How: Aggregate ingestion jobs by idempotency key and detect multi-endpoint collisions.
When: Use to detect client integration anti-patterns before they create replay ambiguity.
